intro: Crantzia circinnata, commonly known as the spiral crantzia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and narrow, linear leaves that are often arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Its flowers are small and yellow, typically appearing in clusters at the ends of the stems. Crantzia circinnata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
